title: An investigation using DFT into the impact of hydrogen on oxygen migration processes during aluminum anodization
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,11668-11675
DOI: 10.1039/D3RA08693C, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Zeyu An, Shiyang Sun, Binghai Dong
The H atoms reduce the energy barrier for O entering the crystal of aluminum, from 1.52 eV to 0.78 eV. The introduction of a H atom affects the diffusion of the O atom in the crystal of aluminum, from 1.23 eV to 0.34 eV.
